. 2022 Apr:243:224-227.e2.
doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2021.11.020. Epub 2021 Nov 16.

Do Clinical Data from Transgender Adolescents Support the Phenomenon of "Rapid Onset Gender Dysphoria"?

Greta R Bauer  1 , Margaret L Lawson  2 , Daniel L Metzger  3 ; Trans Youth CAN! Research Team
Affiliations

Affiliations

  • 1 Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Schulich School of Medicine and Dentistry, Western University, London, Canada. Electronic address: gbauer@uwo.ca.
  • 2 Division of Endocrinology and Metabolism, Department of Pediatrics, Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario, University of Ottawa, Ottawa, Canada.
  • 3 Division of Endocrinology, Department of Pediatrics, BC Children's Hospital, University of British Columbia, Vancouver, Canada.
  • PMID: 34793826
  • DOI: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2021.11.020
Free article
Item in Clipboard
Case Reports

Do Clinical Data from Transgender Adolescents Support the Phenomenon of "Rapid Onset Gender Dysphoria"?

Greta R Bauer et al. J Pediatr. 2022 Apr.
Free article
Display options
Format
Actions
  • Search in PubMed
  • Search in NLM Catalog
  • Add to Search
. 2022 Apr:243:224-227.e2.
doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2021.11.020. Epub 2021 Nov 16.

Authors

Greta R Bauer  1 , Margaret L Lawson  2 , Daniel L Metzger  3 ; Trans Youth CAN! Research Team

Affiliations

  • 1 Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Schulich School of Medicine and Dentistry, Western University, London, Canada. Electronic address: gbauer@uwo.ca.
  • 2 Division of Endocrinology and Metabolism, Department of Pediatrics, Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario, University of Ottawa, Ottawa, Canada.
  • 3 Division of Endocrinology, Department of Pediatrics, BC Children's Hospital, University of British Columbia, Vancouver, Canada.
  • PMID: 34793826
  • DOI: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2021.11.020
Item in Clipboard
Display options
Format

Abstract

Although emergence of gender dysphoria at puberty is long established, a distinct pathway of rapid onset gender dysphoria was recently hypothesized based on parental data. Using adolescent clinical data, we tested a series of associations that would be consistent with this pathway, however, our results did not support the rapid onset gender dysphoria hypothesis.

Copyright © 2021 The Author(s). Published by Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

PubMed Disclaimer

Comment in

  • Rapid onset gender dysphoria as a distinct clinical phenomenon.
    Sinai J. Sinai J. J Pediatr. 2022 Jun;245:250. doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2022.03.005. Epub 2022 Mar 8. J Pediatr. 2022. PMID: 35276122 No abstract available.
  • Reply.
    Bauer GR, Lawson ML, Metzger DL. Bauer GR, et al. J Pediatr. 2022 Jun;245:251. doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2022.03.004. Epub 2022 Mar 8. J Pediatr. 2022. PMID: 35276123 No abstract available.
  • Saying that Bauer et al studied rapid onset gender dysphoria is inaccurate and misleading.
    Littman L. Littman L. J Pediatr. 2022 Jun;245:250. doi: 10.1016/j.jpeds.2022.03.003. Epub 2022 Mar 8. J Pediatr. 2022. PMID: 35276124 No abstract available.

Similar articles

  • Parent reports of adolescents and young adults perceived to show signs of a rapid onset of gender dysphoria.
    Littman L. Littman L. PLoS One. 2018 Aug 16;13(8):e0202330. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0202330. eCollection 2018. PLoS One. 2018. PMID: 30114286 Free PMC article.
  • What the Primary Care Pediatrician Needs to Know About Gender Incongruence and Gender Dysphoria in Children and Adolescents.
    de Vries AL, Klink D, Cohen-Kettenis PT. de Vries AL, et al. Pediatr Clin North Am. 2016 Dec;63(6):1121-1135. doi: 10.1016/j.pcl.2016.07.011. Epub 2016 Oct 14. Pediatr Clin North Am. 2016. PMID: 27865337 Review.
  • Advances in the Care of Transgender Children and Adolescents.
    Shumer DE, Nokoff NJ, Spack NP. Shumer DE, et al. Adv Pediatr. 2016 Aug;63(1):79-102. doi: 10.1016/j.yapd.2016.04.018. Epub 2016 Jun 3. Adv Pediatr. 2016. PMID: 27426896 Free PMC article. Review.
  • We Are all Responsible for Transgender Care.
    Cohen A, Gomez-Lobo V. Cohen A, et al. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2022 Feb 17;107(3):e1310-e1311. doi: 10.1210/clinem/dgab723. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2022. PMID: 34610122 Free PMC article. No abstract available.
  • Transgender and Gender Nonconforming Youth.
    Forcier M, Olson J. Forcier M, et al. Adolesc Med State Art Rev. 2014 Aug;25(2):377-97. Adolesc Med State Art Rev. 2014. PMID: 27132320 No abstract available.

    Brecht A, Bos S, Ries L, Hübner K, Widenka PM, Winter SM, Calvano C. Brecht A, et al. Child Adolesc Psychiatry Ment Health. 2024 Mar 2;18(1):30. doi: 10.1186/s13034-024-00718-y. Child Adolesc Psychiatry Ment Health. 2024. PMID: 38431595 Free PMC article.
  • Perspective on equitable translational studies and clinical support for an unbiased inclusion of the LGBTQIA2S+community.
    Goetz TG, Aghi K, Anacker C, Ehrensaft D, Eshel N, Marrocco J, Young JW, Roepke TA. Goetz TG, et al. Neuropsychopharmacology. 2023 May;48(6):852-856. doi: 10.1038/s41386-023-01558-8. Epub 2023 Mar 16. Neuropsychopharmacology. 2023. PMID: 36928352 Free PMC article. Review.
  • Rapid Onset Gender Dysphoria: Parent Reports on 1655 Possible Cases.
    Diaz S, Bailey JM. Diaz S, et al. Arch Sex Behav. 2023 Apr;52(3):1031-1043. doi: 10.1007/s10508-023-02576-9. Epub 2023 Mar 29. Arch Sex Behav. 2023. Retraction in: Arch Sex Behav. 2023 Nov;52(8):3577. doi: 10.1007/s10508-023-02635-1 PMID: 36991212 Free PMC article. Retracted.
  • Demographics and gender-related measures in younger and older adolescents presenting to a gender service.
    Arnoldussen M, de Rooy FBB, de Vries ALC, van der Miesen AIR, Popma A, Steensma TD. Arnoldussen M, et al. Eur Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2023 Dec;32(12):2537-2546. doi: 10.1007/s00787-022-02082-8. Epub 2022 Nov 12. Eur Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2023. PMID: 36370316 Free PMC article.
  • Gender dysphoria in adolescence: examining the rapid-onset hypothesis.
    Leonhardt A, Fuchs M, Gander M, Sevecke K. Leonhardt A, et al. Neuropsychiatr. 2024 Jul 1. doi: 10.1007/s40211-024-00500-8. Online ahead of print. Neuropsychiatr. 2024. PMID: 38951367 Review. English.

finalizedMeta.description: Although emergence of gender dysphoria at puberty is long established, a distinct pathway of rapid onset gender dysphoria was recently hypothesized based on parental data. Using adolescent clinical data, we tested a series of associations that would be consistent with this pathway, however, our resu …
